title: MatchCharacter API in SKFontManager Hangs in Xamarin.iOS
body:
**Description**

 MatchCharacter API in SKFontManager Hangs when passing character '\ud83d' as parameter in Xamarin.iOS

**Code**

SKFontManager.Default.MatchCharacter('\ud83d')

**Expected Behavior**

application should not hang

**Actual Behavior**

Application hangs.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.59.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: Xamarin.iOS
  - iOS:  12.1
- Target Devices:  iPhone XR

> VS bug [#802930](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/802930)

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: That is not a valid character. I wonder how native Skia reacts to it. Will try to find out.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I am going to mark this as a bug because it should not hang, regardless.

Looking at that code, you seem to be using single quotes (as in a char type)? Can you try a string? You may have to do this:

```
var theChar = StringUtilities.GetUnicodeCharacterCode("\ud83d", SKTextEncoding.Utf32);
```

There might be an issue converting the char to whatever skia uses under the hood. You can also try one of the other unicode formats and see what happens.

comments.author: selvarathinamm
comments.body:
I have tried suggested code and it throws an exception.

**Exception details:**
Unhandled Exception:
System.ArgumentException: character
Parameter name: Only a single character can be specified. occurred

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body:
'\ud83d' is a high surrogate of a pair you can't use it alone even when it was a valid character. Your calling code is probably missing some checks. 

Something like this:

```
var codePoint = char.IsHighSurrogate(text[0])
                                        ? char.ConvertToUtf32(text[0], text[1])
                                        : text[0];
```
